data.event: Lewiston was founded 155 years ago in 1861 in the wake of a gold rush which began the previous year near Pierce, northeast of Lewiston.

event.title: 1861 in the wake of a gold rush which began

data.event: Lewiston was founded 155 years ago in 1861 in the wake of a gold rush which began the previous year near Pierce, northeast of Lewiston.
In 1863, Lewiston became the first capital of the newly created Idaho Territory.

event.title: was passed by the Idaho Territorial Legislature on December 7, 1864

data.event: Its stint as seat of the new territory's government was short-lived, as a resolution to have the capital moved south to Boise was passed by the Idaho Territorial Legislature on December 7, 1864.
